titlestmt.titleproper: Selected art related documents from the Woodhouse collection in hte Historical Society of Pennsylvania

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:52:23 -0400.

did.unittitle: Selected art related documents from the Woodhouse collection in the Historical Society of Pennsylvania

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An invitation to William Meredith for the eighth annual exhibition of the Artists' Fund Society "Private View," Apr. 3, 1843; circular letters, Mar. 13, 1834 and Oct. 1834, concerning the finances of the Pennsylvania Academy and the durability of the members. The first letter is signed by Joseph Hopkinson and the second by William Strickland, Henry Inman, Charles Graff, Cephas G. Childs, J. K. Kane, and Nathan Dunn. Also, correspondence between David Hosack and William Meredith, Jan. 12 and 18, 1817, about Thomas Sully's portrait of Gouverneur Morris; and a letter to Nicholas Biddle from Rembrandt Peale, concerning a portrait of Mr. Dennie and a copy for Biddle, with a note by Biddle at the bottom of the page.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel P24 (frames 94-100) available for use at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals in Historical Society of Pennsylvania, Woodhouse Collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Microfilmed by the Historical Society of Pennsylvania for the Archives of American Art, 1955.

controlaccess.corpname: Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts
